Basic concepts¶

QSweepy is a python-based piece of software designed for measurement automation and management. It has several key components:

Basic data structures for measurements and datasets

class ponyfiles.data_structures.MeasurementParameter(*param, **kwargs)¶

Sweep parameter data structure. Data structure has a function (setter), which makes it impractical for serialization.

ponyfiles.data_structures.measurer_point_parameters(measurer)¶

Constructs dictionary of lists containing MeasurementParameter for every parameter

Parameters

measurer – an object that supports get_points(), measure(), get_dtype() and get_opts() methods. e.g. Spectrum_M3i2132

Returns

dictionary containing lists of MeasurementParameter instances

Return type

dict[str, list[MeasurementParameter]]

See also

sweepy.instrument_drivers.Spectrum_M3i2132

Example for measurer that supports get_points()

Savingloading meassurements and other data using the exdir format TODO: add link

Managing and finding measurements in a database using PonyORM and a Postgresql database

class ponyfiles.database.MyDatabase(provider='postgres', user='qsweepy', password='qsweepy', host='localhost', database='qsweepy', port=5432)¶

This class does smth

create_in_database(state)¶

Creates entity instance in program memory space and commits it into the database.

Parameters

state (MeasurementState) –

Returns

id – state database id

Return type

int
